burlap.mdp.singleagent.pomdp.beliefstate

Class TabularBeliefState

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.mdp.singleagent.pomdp.beliefstate.TabularBeliefState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MutableState, State, BeliefState, DenseBeliefVector, EnumerableBeliefState, HashableState

    public class TabularBeliefState
extends Object
implements BeliefState, EnumerableBeliefState, DenseBeliefVector, MutableState, HashableState
    A class for storing a sparse tabular representation of the belief state. That is, each MDP state is assigned a unique identifier using a StateEnumerator and this class uses a Map to associated the probability mass with each state. MDP states that have zero mass are not stored in the map.

    If using a BeliefMDP solver with a TabularBeliefState, it is recommended that you use the ReflectiveHashableStateFactory, since TabularBeliefState implements HashableState and since you probably do not want to do abstraction of the belief state.

      • setBelief

        public void setBelief(State s,
                      double b)
        Sets the probability mass (belief) associated with the underlying MDP state. If this object has not yet assigned a unique identifier to the provided MDP state, then it will first create one. Note that using this method will not ensure that the total probability mass across this belief state sums to 1, so other changes will have to be specified manually.
        Parameters:
        s - the underlying MDP state defined as a State
        b - the probability mass to assigned to the underlying MDP state.

      • setBelief

        public void setBelief(int stateId,
                      double b)
        Sets the probability mass (belief) associated with the underlying MDP state. Note that using this method will not ensure that the total probability mass across this belief state sums to 1, so other changes will have to be specified manually.
        Parameters:
        stateId - the unique numeric identifier of the underlying MDP state defined.
        b - the probability mass to assigned to the underlying MDP state.

      • setBeliefVector

        public void setBeliefVector(double[] b)

        Specified by:
        setBeliefVector in interface DenseBeliefVector

      • initializeAllBeliefValuesTo

        public void initializeAllBeliefValuesTo(double initialValue)
        Initializes the probability mass of all underlying MDP states to the specified value. Note that this will not enforce summing to one, so you will have to manually modify the value of other states if initialValue is not 1/n where n is the number of underlying MDP states.
        Parameters:
        initialValue - the probability mass to assign to each state.

      • copy

        public State copy()
        Description copied from interface: State
        Returns a copy of this state suitable for creating state transitions. This copy may be a shallow copy or deep copy and is domain specific. The State implementation may indicate its copy level with the DeepCopyState or ShallowCopyState annotations. If it is a shallow copy, you should not *directly* modify any fields of a copied state without copying the fields first, or it could contaminate the state from which the copy was made. Alternatively, use the MutableState.set(Object, Object) method to modify ShallowCopyState copied states, which for ShallowCopyState instances should perform a safe copy-on-write operation.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface State
        Returns:
        a copy of this state.
